Ozone (O 3) is mainly found in the stratosphere, but a little amount is generated in the troposphere. Stratospheric ozone (namely the ozone layer) is formed naturally by chemical reactions involving solar ultraviolet (UV) radiation and O 2. Solar UV radiation breaks one O 2 molecule, producing two oxygen atoms (2 O). Then, each of these highly reactive atoms combines with O 2 to produce an (O 3) molecule.
